channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Seahawks vs. Patriots: The Super Bowl rematch no one expected when the season began
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Nora Princiotti of The Ringer to preview this year's Super Bowl matchup between Seattle and New England.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Nora Princiotti of The Ringer to preview this year's Super Bowl matchup between Seattle and New England.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Goodbye, Minute Maid frozen juices
item.description: Coca-Cola, which owns Minute Maid, has announced it will discontinue its line of frozen juice concentrates, which have been a staple in many American homes over the past 80 years.
item.content:encoded: Coca-Cola, which owns Minute Maid, has announced it will discontinue its line of frozen juice concentrates, which have been a staple in many American homes over the past 80 years.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: 2026 Winter Olympics get underway with opening ceremony in Milan
item.description: Elegant and energetic, Milan puts its best foot forward to kick off the 2026 Winter Olympics with a star-studded opening ceremony.
item.content:encoded: Elegant and energetic, Milan puts its best foot forward to kick off the 2026 Winter Olympics with a star-studded opening ceremony.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Wall Street's latest wild week
item.description: The Nasdaq had its worst days since April's tariff turmoil, as investor worries mounted about an AI bubble -- but there were some non-tech bright spots.
item.content:encoded: The Nasdaq had its worst days since April's tariff turmoil, as investor worries mounted about an AI bubble -- but there were some non-tech bright spots.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: California's largest children's hospital system ends gender-affirming care for youth
item.description: Two hospitals in California are discontinuing hormone treatments for transgender youth, citing Trump administration pressures. In the past year, many hospitals and clinics have scaled back that care.
item.content:encoded: Two hospitals in California are discontinuing hormone treatments for transgender youth, citing Trump administration pressures. In the past year, many hospitals and clinics have scaled back that care.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Tidmarsh

item.title: Melinda French Gates on learning to trust again after divorcing Bill Gates
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Melinda French Gates talks about learning to trust again after her divorce.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Melinda French Gates talks about learning to trust again after her divorce.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Japan's first female prime minister stakes her future on snap elections
item.description: Japan's first female premier has called snap elections for Sunday. She seeks a mandate for what could be sweeping changes and possibly a lurch to the political right.
item.content:encoded:
Japan's first female premier has called snap elections for Sunday. She seeks a mandate for what could be sweeping changes and possibly a lurch to the political right.

(Image credit: Philip Fong)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: At Super Bowl time, the NFL cracks down on unlicensed merchandise
item.description: Every year, the NFL battles to protect its trademarks, copyrights and licenses. The league aggressively goes after people who produce counterfeit merchandise. It's a problem during the Super Bowl.
item.content:encoded: Every year, the NFL battles to protect its trademarks, copyrights and licenses. The league aggressively goes after people who produce counterfeit merchandise. It's a problem during the Super Bowl.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: 2 months in, how are Australia's age restrictions for social media working?
item.description: As more countries look to follow Australia's lead and introduce social media bans for children, we ask whether Australia's legislation is working.
item.content:encoded: As more countries look to follow Australia's lead and introduce social media bans for children, we ask whether Australia's legislation is working.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: A study of a remarkable bonobo named Kanzi shows apes may play make believe
item.description: The ability to imagine -- to play pretend -- has long been thought to be unique to humans. A new study suggests certain apes may be able to as well.
item.content:encoded: The ability to imagine -- to play pretend -- has long been thought to be unique to humans. A new study suggests certain apes may be able to as well.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott
